title: Aaron Carter napped through getting a lion tattoo inked on his neck
text:
Aaron Carter feels no pain (Picture: @aaroncarter/Instagram)

Apparently Aaron Carter feels no pain as he napped when he was getting a lion tattoo on his neck.

His Rihanna face tattoo must have felt lonely as he added a lion that took four hours to complete.

The tattoo artist who inked him, Nadia Katherine, told TMZ that the troubled star was lucid and coherent when he entered the tattoo studio but immediately napped once she started the session.

Impressive.

The singer, 31, chose a lion tattoo as it somehow ties to his recent ‘love mantra’.

We’re not entirely sure what that means, but if he’s convinced, so are we.

In a now-deleted Instagram story, Nadia showed herself tattooing the singer and wrote that he ‘slept like an angel’ through the entire ordeal.

Apparently Aaron’s neck is made of bricks (Picture: @aaroncarter/Instagram)

The two originally crossed paths during one of his shows in Nova Scotia, Canada, as her friend was an opening act for the singer.

Advertisement

Aaron also showed off his new lion tat in a video of himself holding his face while turning his head side to side to show both Rihanna – which he only got last month – and the lion.

He captioned the post: ‘Headed back to Cali to pack up my stuff and do some press and move to my Castle’ along with, of course, an emoji of a castle.

Aaron recently announced that he decided to move to Canada.

The I Want Candy singer revealed on Twitter that he is leaving the US to set up home in Nova Scotia while hitting out at Americans and insisting he needs a change of scenery.

No regrets (Picture: Instagram)

Aaron’s impromptu move was sparked after he performed in Halifax and he told followers: ‘So I’m about to get a rental car and drive a few hours to go see my new home. I’m move fast.

‘My Brother in law Mike lives here and my niece Alyssa so I have family here and Nova Scotia is one of my FAVORITE PLACES IN THE WORLd! Plus it makes for shorter flights for Europe tour.’

Insisting the move is for the better, Aaron added: ‘I absolutely love my new peace of mind here. I’m very happy and have found solidarity, solitude and peace where I can’t be found and have my privacy make my music and enjoy a healthy long prosperous life.’
